quiz.title: Physics Grade 11: Kinematics on Inclined Surfaces
quiz.subtitle: Unit 2 Quiz 4: Motion on Inclined Planes (10 Problems)
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: A skier starts from rest at the top of a 20° slope and accelerates uniformly down the incline. If she reaches a speed of 15 m/s after traveling 40 m down the slope, what is her acceleration? (Assume no friction)
A block is projected up a 25° incline with an initial speed of 8.0 m/s. The coefficient of kinetic friction is μ_k = 0.20. How far up the incline does it travel before coming to rest?
questions.explanation: Acceleration up incline: a = -g(sinθ + μ_k cosθ) = -9.8(0.4226 + 0.1813) = -5.918 m/s². Distance: 0 = 8.0² + 2(-5.918)d → d = 64/11.836 ≈ 5.41 m.

questions.question: A box slides down a 30° incline from rest. If it takes 4.0 s to reach the bottom, what is the length of the incline? (Assume no friction)
questions.explanation: Acceleration a = g sinθ = 4.9 m/s². Distance d = ½at² = 0.5 × 4.9 × 16 = 39.2 m.

questions.question: A car coasts up a 10° hill with an initial speed of 20 m/s. Ignoring friction and air resistance, how far up the hill does it travel before stopping?
questions.explanation: Acceleration a = -g sinθ = -1.701 m/s². Distance: 0 = 20² + 2(-1.701)d → d = 400/3.402 ≈ 117.6 m.

questions.question: A snowboarder starts from rest at the top of a 35° slope that is 50 m long. If there's no friction, what is his speed at the bottom?
questions.explanation: Acceleration a = g sinθ = 5.621 m/s². Speed: v² = 0 + 2 × 5.621 × 50 = 562.1 → v ≈ 23.7 m/s.

questions.question: A block is given an initial push up a 40° incline with speed 6.0 m/s. The coefficient of kinetic friction is μ_k = 0.30. How long does it take to return to its starting point?
questions.explanation: Up: a_up = -g(sinθ + μ_k cosθ) = -8.551 m/s², t_up ≈ 0.7015 s, d ≈ 2.105 m. Down: a_down = g(sinθ - μ_k cosθ) = 4.047 m/s², t_down ≈ 1.020 s. Total ≈ 1.72 s.

questions.question: A ball is rolled up a 15° incline with an initial speed of 12 m/s. How much time elapses before it returns to its starting point? (Assume no friction)
questions.explanation: Acceleration magnitude a = g sinθ = 2.536 m/s². Time up: t_up = 12/2.536 ≈ 4.731 s. Total time = 2 × t_up ≈ 9.46 s.

questions.question: A crate slides down a 28° incline starting from rest. If the incline is 12 m long and it takes 3.5 s to reach the bottom, what is the coefficient of kinetic friction?
questions.explanation: First find acceleration: 12 = 0.5 × a × (3.5)² → a ≈ 1.959 m/s². Then 1.959 = 9.8(sin 28° - μ_k cos 28°) → μ_k ≈ 0.305.

questions.question: A skateboarder rolls down a 22° ramp that is 8.0 m long. If he starts from rest and there's no friction, what is his speed at the bottom?
questions.explanation: Acceleration a = g sinθ = 3.671 m/s². Speed: v² = 0 + 2 × 3.671 × 8.0 = 58.736 → v ≈ 7.66 m/s.

questions.question: A block is projected up a 32° incline with speed 10 m/s. The coefficient of kinetic friction is μ_k = 0.25. What is its speed when it returns to the starting point?
questions.explanation: Up: a_up = -g(sinθ + μ_k cosθ) ≈ -7.271 m/s², distance ≈ 6.877 m. Down: a_down = g(sinθ - μ_k cosθ) ≈ 3.115 m/s², v² = 2 × 3.115 × 6.877 ≈ 42.84 → v ≈ 6.55 m/s.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered kinematics on inclined surfaces with and without friction.
scoreMessages.70: Very good! Solid understanding of inclined plane motion and energy considerations.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Practice distinguishing between frictionless and frictional cases.
scoreMessages.0: Review kinematics equations and force components on inclines.
